data.event: What is now Camden was established on property that was donated by Thomas Dunn in order to have a new town founded on the site.
Dunn's Federal style house, built in 1825, is the oldest documented house in the town.

event.title: was moved to Barboursville, later renamed Camden, in 1833

data.event: It was moved to Barboursville, later renamed Camden, in 1833.
Incorporated in 1841, Camden was renamed by local physician John D. Caldwell in honor of his hometown of Camden, South Carolina.
It also became the home of the red-brick Greek-Revival style Wilcox Female Seminary and Female Institute, built from 1845â€“50.
The red-brick Greek-Revival style Wilcox County Courthouse, also listed on the National Register, was completed in 1857.
